SEARCH
Package ui

Class ClassDiagramUI.UMLComponent

java.lang.Object
ui.ClassDiagramUI.UMLComponent
Enclosing class:
ClassDiagramUI
public class ClassDiagramUI.UMLComponent extends Object
The UMLComponent class is a class that draws a set of UML components (e.g., Class, Association, Inheritance, Aggregation, Composition, Comment, Comment Line) onto the canvas, that can be clicked to edit or delete.

    • id

      public int id

    • isAbstract

      public boolean isAbstract

  • Constructor Details

    • UMLComponent

      public UMLComponent(String type, Point position)
      Constructs a UML component with the specified type and position.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the UML component (e.g., "Class", "Association", etc.)
      position - the position of the component in the form of a Point (x, y).

    • UMLComponent

      public UMLComponent(String type, Point start, Point end)
      Constructs a UML component with the specified type and start/end points for line-based components.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the UML component (e.g., "Association", "Inheritance", etc.)
      start - the starting point of the component (e.g., for associations, lines, etc.)
      end - the ending point of the component (e.g., for associations, lines, etc.)

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public String getType()
      Gets the type of the UML component.
      Returns:
      the type of the component.

    • move

      public void move(Point newPoint)
      Moves the non-line based UML component to a new position, centering the component on the new point.
      Parameters:
      newPoint - the new point to move the component to.

    • moveLine

      public void moveLine(Point newPoint)
      Moves the line-based UML component (e.g., Association, Inheritance etc) to a new position.
      Parameters:
      newPoint - the new point to move the line to.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Point point)
      Checks if the given point is inside the bounds of the UML component.
      Parameters:
      point - the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is inside the component's bounds, false otherwise.

    • containsLine

      public boolean containsLine(Point point)
      Checks if the given point is inside a line-based component (e.g., Association).
      Parameters:
      point - the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is inside the line's bounds, false otherwise.

    • isInResizeHandle

      public boolean isInResizeHandle(Point point)
      Checks if the given point is within the resize handle of the UML component.
      Parameters:
      point - the point to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is inside the resize handle, false otherwise.

    • resize

      public void resize(Point point)
      Resizes the UML component by adjusting its end point.
      Parameters:
      point - the new end point for resizing.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the UML component and updates it in the respective list.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the UML component.

    • calcMaxWidth

      public int calcMaxWidth(Graphics g)
      Calculates the maximum width required for the UML component, based on its name, attributes, and methods.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the maximum width required for the component.

    • containsAttributeOrMethod

      public boolean containsAttributeOrMethod(Point point, String type)
      Checks if the point is within an attribute or method section of the UML component.
      Parameters:
      point - the point to check.
      type - the type of section to check ("attribute" or "method").
      Returns:
      true if the point is inside the attribute or method section, false otherwise.

      Adds a method to the UML component and updates it in the respective class.

    • makeInterface

      public void makeInterface()
      Makes the UML component an interface by adding the appropriate prefix to the name.

    • makeAbstract

      public void makeAbstract()
      Makes the UML component abstract by setting the appropriate flags and updating its state.

    • setCommentText

      public void setCommentText(String newContent)
      Sets the comment text for the UML component, throwing exceptions if invalid input is provided.
      Parameters:
      newContent - the new comment text.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the component type is not "Comment".
      IllegalArgumentException - if the comment text is null or empty.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      Draws the UML component on the provided Graphics object, handling different types of components.
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object used to draw the component.

    • setDrawPartition

      public void setDrawPartition(boolean val)
      Sets the flag to indicate that the component should draw a partition.
      Parameters:
      val - the value indicating whether a partition should be drawn.
